column4: is it possible to grant write access to my ntsf partition using ubuntu live cd?
I didn't think Linux had safe NTFS write access at all.  ??
are you familiar with the 'dd' command?
are you comfortable on the command line?
man dd, and pay close attention to the 'seek' and 'skip' options
that's one way to split up a file
i don't understand man pages. lol
oh, i forgot "are you comforable with man pages?"  ;)
i want to take it anoter way around then. how can i mount a iso file in linux using this live cd?
basically, you tell dd where to get data ("if"), where to put it ("of"), how big each data chunk should be ("bs", I use "bs=1M"), and how many data chunks to move ("count").
then you can tell dd how much of the input to skip ("skip") and how far to seek into the output before writing ("seek").
thanks! then i can just burn out cd's from the iso! (it is a dvd iso but i just have a cd-writer)
